text: {{Infobox Writer | name = Ken Kesey | image = Ken Kesey in Pasadena in 1974 from The Big T 1974 (page 45 crop).jpg | birth_date = September 17, 1935 | birth_place = La Junta, Colorado, United States | death_date = | death_place = Pleasant Hill, Oregon, United States | occupation = Novelist, Short story writer, Essayist | nationality = American | genre = Beat, Postmodernism | movement = Merry Pranksters | notableworks = One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest | website = }} Kenneth Elton Kesey (September 17, 1935 â€“ November 10, 2001) was an American writer best known for his novel One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest. He was born in La Junta, Colorado and moved to Springfield, Oregon in 1946.Malin, C., "Experiencing Ken Kesey" , The Broadside, November 29, 2014. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Oregon Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:Writers from Colorado Category:Writers from Oregon Category:People from Springfield, Oregon
title: Ken Kesey
